Description: Handle-plate sherd of black-figured East Greek pottery column-krater with part of handle; underside; partly glazed; outside and edges of plate glazed; on top of plate, siren (legs and part of wing lost) to right, looking back; red on hair, row of white dots at top of wing, wing feathers white, red and black, tail feathers alternating red and white over black; short tail feathers black with rows of short incised strokes; double incised lines at top of wing and tail feathers. Ancient drill hole to aid firing.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.315)
